canonical_explanation.text: All living things are made of cells. The cell is the basic unit of life. Robert Hooke discovered cells in 1665. A cell has three main parts: cell membrane (outer covering), cytoplasm (jelly-like substance), and nucleus (controls cell activities). Plant cells have additional features: cell wall (for support), chloroplasts (for making food), and larger vacuoles. Animal cells lack cell wall and chloroplasts. Unicellular organisms like amoeba and bacteria are made of one cell. Multicellular organisms like plants and animals are made of many cells working together.
rules: Cell membrane: outer covering of all cells
Plant cells have cell wall for support
Plant cells have chloroplasts for making food

questions.question_text: The basic unit of life is called:
questions.explanation_correct: The basic unit of life is called a cell. All living things, whether small like bacteria or large like elephants, are made up of cells. Cells are the smallest units that can carry out all the basic functions of life, like respiration, nutrition, and reproduction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The basic unit of life is not an atom, organ, or tissue. Atoms are the smallest particles of matter, but they cannot carry out the basic functions of life on their own. Organs and tissues are made up of many cells working together, but they are not the basic unit of life. The cell is the basic unit of life because it is the smallest structure that can perform all the essential life processes.

questions.question_text: Who discovered cells?
questions.explanation_correct: Robert Hooke was the scientist who discovered cells in 1665 using a microscope. He observed thin slices of cork and saw many small 'rooms' which he called 'cells'.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct. Isaac Newton was a famous scientist who discovered the laws of motion, but he did not discover cells. Albert Einstein was a physicist who developed the theory of relativity, and Charles Darwin was a naturalist who proposed the theory of evolution, but neither of them discovered cells.

questions.question_text: Which part of the cell controls its activities?
questions.explanation_correct: The nucleus is the part of the cell that controls all the activities of the cell. It contains the genetic information that tells the cell how to work and grow. The nucleus acts like the 'brain' of the cell, directing everything that happens inside it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The cell membrane, cytoplasm, and cell wall are all important parts of the cell, but they do not control the cell's activities. The nucleus is the control center of the cell that directs all the cell's functions. It contains the genetic information that tells the cell how to work and grow.

questions.question_text: The jelly-like substance inside a cell is called:
questions.explanation_correct: The jelly-like substance inside a cell is called the cytoplasm. The cytoplasm is where all the important activities of the cell take place.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'Cytoplasm'. The cytoplasm is the jelly-like substance inside the cell where all the important activities happen. The nucleus is the control center of the cell, the cell wall provides support to plant cells, and the chloroplasts are structures in plant cells that help make food.

questions.question_text: The outer covering of all cells is called:
questions.explanation_correct: The outer covering of all cells is called the cell membrane. The cell membrane is a thin, flexible layer that surrounds the entire cell and controls what goes in and out of the cell.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The cell wall is the outer layer of plant cells, but not animal cells. The cytoplasm is the jelly-like substance inside the cell, and the nucleus is the control center of the cell. The correct answer is the cell membrane, which is the outer covering of all types of cells.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is found only in plant cells?
questions.explanation_correct: The cell wall is a feature that is only found in plant cells, not in animal cells. The cell wall provides support and structure to the plant cell.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The cell wall is the correct answer, as it is a part of the plant cell that is not found in animal cells. Both plant and animal cells have a cell membrane, nucleus, and cytoplasm, so those options are not unique to plant cells.

questions.question_text: Chloroplasts are found in:
questions.explanation_correct: Chloroplasts are found only in plant cells, not in animal cells. Plant cells have chloroplasts to help them make their own food through photosynthesis, but animal cells do not need chloroplasts for this purpose.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Chloroplasts are not found in animal cells. Animal cells lack chloroplasts because they cannot make their own food through photosynthesis like plants can. Only plant cells have chloroplasts, which are special structures that help plants convert sunlight, water, and carbon dioxide into food (sugar) for the plant.

questions.question_text: An organism made of only one cell is called:
questions.explanation_correct: An organism made of only one cell is called unicellular. This is because 'uni' means 'one', so a unicellular organism has just one cell that can perform all the functions of life.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An organism made of many cells working together is called multicellular. This includes plants, animals, and other complex living things. Bicellular means having two cells, and acellular means having no cells at all, which is not true for any living organism.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a unicellular organism?
questions.explanation_correct: Amoeba is a unicellular organism, which means it is made of only one cell. Unlike plants and animals, which are made of many cells working together, amoeba is a single-celled living thing.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cat and a fish are multicellular organisms, meaning they are made of many cells working together. A tree is also a multicellular organism, made of many plant cells. Only amoeba, which is a single-celled organism, is the correct answer choice.

questions.question_text: What gives plant cells their green colour?
questions.explanation_correct: Plant cells have small structures called chloroplasts that contain a green chemical called chlorophyll. This is what gives plant cells their green color.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The nucleus, cell wall and vacuole do not contain chlorophyll, so they do not give plant cells their green color. Chloroplasts are the structures in plant cells that contain chlorophyll and make the cells appear green.

questions.question_text: Why do plant cells have a cell wall but animal cells do not?

options.text: Plants cannot move and need extra support

questions.explanation_correct: Plant cells have a cell wall because plants cannot move around like animals. The cell wall provides extra support and structure to the plant cell, allowing it to stand upright and maintain its shape.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option A is correct. Animal cells do not need a cell wall because they can move around freely. Animals have more flexibility and do not require the extra support that the cell wall provides for plants.

questions.question_text: Why do plant cells have chloroplasts?
questions.explanation_correct: Plant cells have chloroplasts because these structures contain chlorophyll, a green pigment that allows the plant cell to make its own food through the process of photosynthesis. This is important for the plant to grow and survive.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Plant cells do not have chloroplasts for protection, movement, or storing water. Chloroplasts are organelles inside plant cells that contain chlorophyll and allow the cell to produce its own food through photosynthesis. This is the main function of chloroplasts in plant cells.

questions.question_text: A human being is made up of:
questions.explanation_correct: A human being is made up of trillions of cells because our body is extremely complex and needs many different types of cells to function properly. Each cell has a specific job, and all the cells work together as a team to keep us alive and healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A human being is not made up of only one cell or ten cells. Our body is made up of trillions of cells, which is a huge number. Each cell has its own job to do, and all the cells work together to keep our body running. So the correct answer is that a human being is made up of trillions of cells.

questions.question_text: If the nucleus of a cell is removed, what will happen?

options.text: The cell cannot function properly and will die

questions.explanation_correct: The nucleus is the control center of the cell. It controls all the activities of the cell. If the nucleus is removed, the cell cannot function properly and will die.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option A is incorrect because the cell cannot work normally without the nucleus. The nucleus is very important for the cell to live and carry out its functions. Option C is incorrect because the cell will not grow bigger if the nucleus is removed. Option D is incorrect because the cell will not divide faster without the nucleus - in fact, it will not be able to divide at all and will die.

questions.question_text: In which year did Robert Hooke discover cells?
questions.explanation_correct: Robert Hooke discovered cells in 1665 using a microscope. This is the correct year, which is option B.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 1665, not the other options. Robert Hooke was the scientist who first discovered cells using a microscope, and he made this discovery in the year 1665, not in 1565, 1765, or 1865.

questions.question_text: Which cell part is larger in plant cells compared to animal cells?
questions.explanation_correct: Plant cells have larger vacuoles compared to animal cells. Vacuoles are structures in the cell that store water, nutrients, and waste. In plant cells, the vacuole takes up a lot of space inside the cell, whereas in animal cells, the vacuoles are smaller.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is C) Vacuole. Plant cells have larger vacuoles compared to animal cells. Vacuoles are structures that store water, nutrients, and waste in the cell. The vacuole takes up a lot of space in plant cells, but animal cells have smaller vacuoles. The nucleus, cytoplasm, and cell membrane are not larger in plant cells compared to animal cells.

questions.question_text: Bacteria is an example of a:
questions.explanation_correct: Bacteria is an example of a unicellular organism because it is made of a single cell. Unicellular organisms like bacteria and amoeba are made of just one cell that can carry out all the functions of life.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Bacteria is not a multicellular organism, plant, or animal. Multicellular organisms like plants and animals are made of many cells working together. Plants have cells with a cell wall, chloroplasts, and large vacuoles. Animal cells do not have a cell wall or chloroplasts. Bacteria is a single-celled organism, so the correct answer is that it is a unicellular organism.

questions.question_text: Robert Hooke observed cells in which material?
questions.explanation_correct: Robert Hooke observed cells in cork (the bark of a tree) using an early microscope. This was one of the earliest discoveries of cells, which are the basic units of all living things.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Robert Hooke did not observe cells in animal skin, human blood, or pond water. He discovered cells by looking at thin slices of cork (the bark of a tree) under an early microscope. This was an important discovery that helped us understand how living things are made of tiny units called cells.

questions.question_text: The cell membrane is important because it:

options.text: Controls what enters and leaves the cell
Gives the cell a fixed shape

questions.explanation_correct: The cell membrane is important because it controls what enters and leaves the cell. It acts like a gatekeeper, allowing only certain substances to pass through and keeping others out. This helps the cell get the nutrients it needs and get rid of waste products.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The cell membrane is not responsible for producing food or making the cell green. Those are functions of other parts of the cell, like the chloroplasts. The cell membrane also doesn't give the cell a fixed shape - that is the job of the cell wall in plant cells. The cell membrane's main role is to control what goes in and out of the cell.

questions.question_text: Which statement is TRUE about plant and animal cells?

options.text: Both have cell membrane, cytoplasm, and nucleus

questions.explanation_correct: The statement that both plant and animal cells have cell membrane, cytoplasm, and nucleus is true. These are the three main parts found in all living cells, whether they belong to a plant or an animal.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not entirely true. While plant cells do have a cell wall, animal cells do not. Similarly, only plant cells have chloroplasts, which are structures that help the plant make its own food. Both plant and animal cells have a nucleus, which controls the cell's activities.

questions.question_text: An advantage of being multicellular is that:

options.text: Different cells can do different jobs
The organism does not need food

questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is B because in a multicellular organism, different cells can specialize and do different jobs. This allows the organism to function better and do more tasks compared to a single-celled organism.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is B. Being multicellular does not mean the organism is always smaller. It also does not mean the organism lives in water or does not need food. The advantage of being multicellular is that different cells can do different jobs to help the organism survive and grow, which a single-celled organism cannot do.

questions.question_text: All living things are made of:
questions.explanation_correct: All living things, from the smallest microbes to the largest animals and plants, are made up of cells. Cells are the basic building blocks of life, and they come in many different shapes and sizes depending on the organism.
questions.explanation_incorrect: While water, air, and rocks are important parts of the environment, they are not the basic building blocks of living things. Cells are the smallest units of life, and every living organism, from a tiny bacteria to a giant whale, is made up of one or more cells.

questions.question_text: Why can't animal cells make their own food?

options.text: They don't have a cell membrane

questions.explanation_correct: Animal cells cannot make their own food because they do not have chloroplasts. Chloroplasts are the structures in plant cells that contain chlorophyll and allow the cell to make food through photosynthesis. Since animal cells lack chloroplasts, they cannot produce their own food.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is that animal cells cannot make their own food because they don't have chloroplasts. Options A, C, and D are incorrect. Animal cells do have a nucleus that controls the cell's activities, and they have a cell membrane. The size of the cell is not the reason they cannot make their own food.

questions.question_text: Paramecium is an example of a:
questions.explanation_correct: Paramecium is an example of a unicellular organism because it is made of only one cell. Unicellular organisms like Paramecium, amoeba, and bacteria are living things that have only one cell, while multicellular organisms like plants and animals have many cells working together.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Paramecium is not a multicellular organism, plant, or virus. It is a unicellular organism because it is made up of a single cell. Multicellular organisms like plants and animals are made up of many cells working together, while viruses are not even living things - they are smaller than cells and can only reproduce inside other living cells.

questions.question_text: To see cells, we need a:
questions.explanation_correct: A microscope is the right tool to see cells because it uses lenses to magnify and make tiny objects like cells appear larger and more visible to the eye. Telescopes are used to observe distant objects in space, while magnifying glasses can only slightly increase the size of an object, not enough to see cells.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A telescope is used to observe distant objects in space, not tiny living things like cells. Cells are very small and need special tools like a microscope to be seen clearly. A microscope uses lenses to magnify and enlarge the image of the cell, making it visible to our eyes.

questions.question_text: The cell wall provides:
questions.explanation_correct: The cell wall provides support and protection to the plant cell. It is made of a tough material called cellulose, which gives the cell its shape and helps it to withstand external forces.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The cell wall does not provide food for the cell. The cell gets its food through the process of photosynthesis, which takes place in the chloroplasts. The cell wall also does not give the cell its green color. That is due to the presence of chlorophyll in the chloroplasts. Additionally, the cell wall does not provide energy for movement, as plant cells do not have the ability to move on their own.

questions.question_text: How many main parts does a basic cell have?
questions.explanation_correct: The main parts of a basic cell are the cell membrane (outer covering), cytoplasm (jelly-like substance), and nucleus (controls cell activities). This means a basic cell has three main parts, so the correct answer is option B.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A basic cell does not have two, four, or five main parts. It has three main parts: the cell membrane, cytoplasm, and nucleus. So options A, C, and D are incorrect. The correct answer is option B, which states that a basic cell has three main parts.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a multicellular organism?
questions.explanation_correct: The mango tree is a multicellular organism because it is made up of many cells working together, not just one cell like amoeba or bacteria. Multicellular organisms have many specialized cells that perform different functions.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Amoeba and bacteria are single-celled organisms, meaning they are made up of only one cell. They are not considered multicellular organisms. The mango tree, on the other hand, is a multicellular organism because it is made up of many specialized cells that work together to perform different functions.

questions.question_text: The vacuole in a plant cell stores:
questions.explanation_correct: The vacuole in a plant cell stores water and dissolved substances. Vacuoles are large, fluid-filled sacs that help the plant cell store water, nutrients, and waste products.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The vacuole in a plant cell does not store only air. Air is not the main thing stored in plant cell vacuoles. Instead, vacuoles store water and dissolved substances that the plant needs, like nutrients and other materials. So option B, 'water and dissolved substances', is the correct answer.

questions.question_text: The nucleus is often called the _____ of the cell.
questions.explanation_correct: The nucleus is called the control centre of the cell because it controls all the activities and functions of the cell. It contains the genetic information that tells the cell what to do.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The nucleus is not the kitchen, power house, or wall of the cell. The kitchen is where food is prepared, the power house is where energy is produced, and the wall is the outer layer that gives the cell structure. The nucleus is the control centre that directs all the activities of the cell.

questions.question_text: All living things are made of cells.
questions.explanation_correct: The statement 'All living things are made of cells' is true. This is because all living organisms, whether they are plants, animals, or single-celled organisms like bacteria, are made up of tiny units called cells. Cells are the basic building blocks of life, and every living thing, no matter how small or large, is composed of one or more cells.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement 'All living things are made of cells' is true. This is because all living organisms, whether they are plants, animals, or single-celled organisms like bacteria, are made up of tiny units called cells. Cells are the basic building blocks of life, and every living thing, no matter how small or large, is composed of one or more cells. Some people might think that this is not true, but this is a misconception. All living things, from the smallest bacteria to the largest whales, are made of cells.

questions.question_text: Robert Hooke discovered cells in 1865.
questions.explanation_correct: The statement is false. Robert Hooke discovered cells in 1665, not 1865. He was the first person to see and describe cells using a microscope.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is incorrect. Robert Hooke discovered cells in 1665, not 1865. He was a British scientist who first observed cells under a microscope and named them 'cells' because they reminded him of the small rooms, or cells, that monks lived in.

questions.question_text: Animal cells have a cell wall.
questions.explanation_correct: Animal cells do not have a cell wall. Plant cells have a cell wall, but animal cells only have a cell membrane as their outer covering. The cell wall is a feature unique to plant cells and provides structural support, but animal cells do not need this additional layer.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement that animal cells have a cell wall is false. Animal cells only have a cell membrane as their outer covering, which is different from the cell wall found in plant cells. The cell wall in plant cells provides structural support, but animal cells do not need this additional layer.

questions.question_text: The nucleus controls the activities of the cell.
questions.explanation_correct: The statement is true. The nucleus is the control center of the cell. It contains the cell's DNA, which provides instructions for all the cell's activities and functions.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is true. The nucleus is the control center of the cell and it controls all the activities that happen inside the cell. It is like the 'brain' of the cell, telling it what to do and how to do it.

questions.question_text: Chloroplasts are present in both plant and animal cells.
questions.explanation_correct: Chloroplasts are only present in plant cells, not in animal cells. Chloroplasts are the structures in plant cells that contain chlorophyll, which helps plants make their own food through photosynthesis.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is false. Chloroplasts are found only in plant cells, not in animal cells. Animal cells do not have chloroplasts because they cannot perform photosynthesis like plants do. Chloroplasts are important for plants to make their own food, but animal cells get their food from other sources.

questions.question_text: Amoeba is a multicellular organism.
questions.explanation_correct: Amoeba is a unicellular organism, meaning it is made of only one cell. Multicellular organisms are made of many cells working together, like plants and animals. So the statement 'Amoeba is a multicellular organism' is false.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Amoeba is a unicellular organism, meaning it is made of only one cell. Multicellular organisms like plants and animals are made of many cells working together. So amoeba, being a single-celled organism, is not a multicellular organism.

questions.question_text: Plant cells have larger vacuoles than animal cells.
questions.explanation_correct: Plant cells have larger vacuoles than animal cells. Vacuoles are like storage spaces in the cell. Plants need larger vacuoles to store more water, food, and other materials they produce.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Animal cells do not have larger vacuoles than plant cells. In fact, plant cells have larger vacuoles compared to animal cells. Vacuoles are spaces inside the cell that store water, nutrients, and other materials. Since plants need to store more of these materials, their vacuoles are bigger in size than the vacuoles found in animal cells.

questions.question_text: Cytoplasm is found outside the cell membrane.
questions.explanation_correct: The statement is false. Cytoplasm is found inside the cell membrane, not outside it. The cell membrane is the outer covering of the cell, and the cytoplasm is the jelly-like substance found within the cell, surrounding the nucleus.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is false because cytoplasm is found inside the cell membrane, not outside it. The cell membrane is the outer covering of the cell, and the cytoplasm is the jelly-like substance found within the cell, surrounding the nucleus. Many people might think that cytoplasm is found outside the cell membrane, but this is not correct. The cytoplasm is always located inside the cell.

questions.question_text: Cells can only be seen with the naked eye.
questions.explanation_correct: Cells are too small to be seen with the naked eye. They can only be seen with the help of a microscope, which makes them appear much larger.
questions.explanation_incorrect: It is false that cells can only be seen with the naked eye. Cells are extremely small, and we need a microscope to see them. Robert Hooke used a microscope to discover cells in 1665. Cells are the basic unit of life, and they are too small to be seen without a microscope.

questions.question_text: All cells have a cell membrane.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, all cells have a cell membrane. The cell membrane is the outer covering of the cell that protects the inside of the cell and controls what goes in and out.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Not all cells have a cell wall. Only plant cells have a cell wall, which is made of cellulose and provides extra support and structure to the cell. Animal cells do not have a cell wall, but they do have a cell membrane that performs the same function of protecting the cell and controlling what goes in and out.

questions.question_text: The _____ is the basic unit of life.
questions.explanation_correct: The cell is the basic unit of life because all living things are made up of cells. Cells are the smallest building blocks that make up living organisms, whether they are single-celled like bacteria or multi-celled like plants and animals.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer is 'cell' because all living things are made up of cells. Cells are the smallest units that can carry out the basic functions of life, like growing, reproducing, and responding to the environment. Organisms that are made up of only one cell are called unicellular, while those made up of many cells working together are called multicellular.

questions.question_text: _____ Hooke discovered cells in 1665.
questions.explanation_correct: The answer 'Robert' is correct because Robert Hooke was the scientist who discovered cells in 1665. He was the first person to observe and describe cells under a microscope.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'Robert' because Robert Hooke was the scientist who discovered cells in 1665. The question is asking for the name of the person who discovered cells, and the accepted answer format is a single name, so 'Robert' is the correct response.

questions.question_text: The _____ is the control centre of the cell.
questions.explanation_correct: The nucleus is the control centre of the cell because it contains the genetic information (DNA) that tells the cell how to function and grow. It controls all the activities that happen inside the cell.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format is 'nucleus'. The nucleus is the control centre of the cell because it contains the genetic information (DNA) that tells the cell how to function and grow. It controls all the activities that happen inside the cell. Other parts of the cell, like the cell membrane or cytoplasm, do not control the cell's activities like the nucleus does.

questions.question_text: The jelly-like substance inside a cell is called _____.
questions.explanation_correct: The jelly-like substance inside a cell is called cytoplasm. The cytoplasm is where all the cell's activities and processes take place, like digestion and energy production.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is cytoplasm. The cytoplasm is the jelly-like material that fills the inside of a cell. It is not the cell membrane (the outer covering), nor the nucleus (the control center). The cytoplasm is where all the important functions of the cell happen.

questions.question_text: The _____ membrane is the outer covering of all cells.
questions.explanation_correct: The cell membrane is the outer covering of all cells, both plant and animal. It protects the inside of the cell and controls what goes in and out of the cell. This is an important part of the cell that helps it function properly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer is 'cell', not 'cell membrane'. The cell membrane is just one part of the cell. The cell is the basic unit of life and it has three main parts: the cell membrane (outer covering), the cytoplasm (jelly-like substance), and the nucleus (controls the cell's activities). The cell membrane is important, but the entire cell is the correct answer here.

questions.question_text: Plant cells have _____ which help them make food.
questions.explanation_correct: Plant cells have chloroplasts, which are special structures that help the plant make its own food through a process called photosynthesis. Chloroplasts contain a green substance called chlorophyll, which absorbs sunlight and helps the plant convert water and carbon dioxide into glucose, the plant's source of food.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'chloroplasts'. Plant cells do not have cell walls, vacuoles, or cytoplasm to help them make food. Instead, they have specialized structures called chloroplasts that contain chlorophyll. This chlorophyll helps the plant absorb sunlight and convert water and carbon dioxide into glucose, which is the food the plant uses to grow and thrive.

questions.question_text: The _____ wall provides support and protection to plant cells.
questions.explanation_correct: The cell wall provides support and protection to plant cells. It is a rigid structure made of cellulose that surrounds the cell membrane and gives the cell its shape and strength. This helps the plant cell maintain its structure and withstand external forces.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format is 'cell'. This is because plant cells have a cell wall, which is a rigid structure made of cellulose that surrounds the cell membrane. The cell wall provides support and protection to the plant cell, helping it maintain its shape and structure. Animal cells, on the other hand, do not have a cell wall.

questions.question_text: Organisms made of one cell are called _____ organisms.
questions.explanation_correct: Organisms made of only one cell are called unicellular organisms. This is because 'uni' means one, and 'cellular' means cell. So unicellular organisms are single-celled organisms.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'unicellular' organisms. This means organisms that are made up of only one cell. Many tiny living things like bacteria and amoeba are unicellular. Multicellular organisms like plants and animals are made up of many cells working together.

questions.question_text: _____ is an example of a unicellular organism.
questions.explanation_correct: Amoeba is an example of a unicellular organism because it is made up of just one cell. Unicellular organisms like amoeba and bacteria are made of a single cell that can carry out all the basic functions of life.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is Amoeba. Amoeba is a single-celled organism, which means it is made up of only one cell. It is an example of a unicellular organism. Other unicellular organisms include bacteria. Multicellular organisms like plants and animals are made up of many cells working together.

questions.question_text: Organisms made of many cells are called _____ organisms.
questions.explanation_correct: Organisms made of many cells are called multicellular organisms because 'multi' means many, and 'cellular' means cells. Multicellular organisms like plants and animals have many cells working together to carry out their life activities.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'multicellular'. Unicellular organisms are made of only one cell, while multicellular organisms are made of many cells working together. So the term for organisms made of many cells is 'multicellular'.

questions.question_text: The _____ in plant cells is larger than in animal cells.
questions.explanation_correct: The vacuole in plant cells is larger than in animal cells. Plant cells have large, fluid-filled spaces called vacuoles, which store water, nutrients, and waste. This helps plant cells stay firm and provides support to the plant.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'vacuole'. Plant cells have a large, fluid-filled space called a vacuole, which is bigger than the vacuoles in animal cells. Vacuoles in plant cells help store water, nutrients, and waste, and provide support to the plant. Animal cells do not have such large vacuoles.

questions.question_text: We need a _____ to observe cells.
questions.explanation_correct: We need a microscope to observe cells because they are very small and cannot be seen with the naked eye. A microscope uses lenses to magnify and focus the image of the cell, allowing us to see its different parts and details.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We cannot observe cells without a microscope. Cells are very small, and the human eye cannot see them clearly. A microscope uses lenses to magnify and focus the image of the cell, making it visible for us to study. The correct answer is 'microscope'.

questions.question_text: Arrange the parts of a cell from outside to inside:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order from outside to inside of a cell is cell membrane, cytoplasm, and then nucleus. This is because the cell membrane is the outer covering that surrounds the cell, the cytoplasm is the jelly-like substance inside the cell, and the nucleus is the control center located within the cytoplasm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be nucleus, cytoplasm, cell membrane. This is not correct because the nucleus is located inside the cell, not on the outside. The cytoplasm surrounds the nucleus, and the cell membrane is the outer covering of the cell. The correct order is cell membrane, cytoplasm, and then nucleus.

questions.question_text: Arrange organisms from simple to complex:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order from simple to complex is Amoeba, Fish, Human. Amoeba is a single-celled organism, which means it is the simplest. Fish are multicellular organisms with a more complex body structure. Humans are the most complex, with many different types of cells working together in the body.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be Human, Amoeba, Fish. Humans are not the simplest organism - they are the most complex, with many different types of cells. Amoeba is a single-celled organism, which is simpler than the multicellular fish. The correct order from simple to complex is Amoeba, Fish, Human.

questions.question_text: Arrange in order of increasing size:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order from smallest to largest is Cell, Tissue, Organ, Organism. This is because a cell is the basic unit of life, and tissues are made of many cells working together. Organs are made of multiple tissues, and organisms are the largest, made of many organs that work together as a whole living thing.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be Organism, Organ, Cell, Tissue. This is wrong because organisms are the largest, made of many organs, and organs are made of many tissues. Cells are the smallest, basic unit of life, and tissues are made of many cells working together. The correct order from smallest to largest is Cell, Tissue, Organ, Organism.

questions.question_text: Arrange plant cell parts from outer to inner:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order from outer to inner is cell wall, cell membrane, cytoplasm, and nucleus. This is because the cell wall is the outermost layer that provides support and protection to the plant cell. Inside the cell wall is the cell membrane, which controls what goes in and out of the cell. The cytoplasm is the jelly-like substance inside the cell membrane, and the nucleus is the control center located within the cytoplasm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be placing the nucleus on the outer side of the cell. This is not correct because the nucleus is the control center of the cell and is located in the innermost part, inside the cytoplasm. The correct order from outer to inner is cell wall, cell membrane, cytoplasm, and then the nucleus.

questions.question_text: Arrange the discovery of cells in chronological order:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is 'Robert Hooke looked at cork', 'Observation under microscope', and then 'Named them cells'. This is because Robert Hooke first observed cork under a microscope, which led him to discover the tiny structures he named 'cells'.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be 'Observation under microscope', 'Named them cells', and then 'Robert Hooke looked at cork'. This is wrong because Robert Hooke first looked at cork under a microscope, which allowed him to discover and name the tiny structures he observed as 'cells'.
